issue.title: Do not remove add-ons from installation dir

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
Allow different homes to share the same base add-ons including the mandatory ones.
Block the add-ons that are not mandatory when not being updated.

Fix #7703.

issue.title: Zap removes required plugins from the installation directory during plugins update

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
### Describe the bug

On the fresh Zap installation the plugins directory looks like the following:

```bash
⋊> /A/O/C/J/plugin pwd
/Applications/OWASP ZAP.app/Contents/Java/plugin

⋊> /A/O/C/J/plugin ls -1
Readme.txt
alertFilters-release-14.zap
ascanrules-release-49.zap
automation-beta-0.19.0.zap
bruteforce-beta-12.zap
callhome-release-0.5.0.zap
commonlib-release-1.11.0.zap
database-alpha-0.1.0.zap
diff-beta-12.zap
directorylistv1-release-5.zap
domxss-release-14.zap
encoder-beta-0.7.0.zap
exim-beta-0.3.0.zap
formhandler-beta-6.1.0.zap
fuzz-beta-13.8.0.zap
gettingStarted-release-14.zap
graaljs-alpha-0.3.0.zap
graphql-alpha-0.11.0.zap
help-release-15.zap
hud-beta-0.15.0.zap
invoke-beta-12.zap
network-beta-0.3.0.zap
oast-beta-0.13.0.zap
onlineMenu-release-10.zap
openapi-beta-29.zap
pscanrules-release-44.zap
quickstart-release-35.zap
replacer-release-11.zap
reports-release-0.16.0.zap
requester-beta-7.0.0.zap
retest-alpha-0.4.0.zap
retire-release-0.16.0.zap
reveal-release-5.zap
scripts-release-33.zap
selenium-release-15.11.0.zap
soap-beta-15.zap
spider-release-0.1.0.zap
spiderAjax-release-23.10.0.zap
tips-beta-10.zap
webdrivermacos-release-47.zap
websocket-release-27.zap
zest-beta-37.zap
```

If I run the `zap.sh` command with the custom home directory then everything works fine:

```bash
⋊> /A/O/C/Java pwd
/Applications/OWASP ZAP.app/Contents/Java

⋊> /A/O/C/Java bash zap.sh -cmd -dir /tmp/somedirectory
Found Java version 11.0.16.1
Available memory: 0 MB
1165 [main] INFO  org.parosproxy.paros.Constant - Copying default configuration to /tmp/somedirectory/config.xml
1300 [main] INFO  org.parosproxy.paros.Constant - Creating directory /tmp/somedirectory/session
1301 [main] INFO  org.parosproxy.paros.Constant - Creating directory /tmp/somedirectory/dirbuster
1302 [main] INFO  org.parosproxy.paros.Constant - Creating directory /tmp/somedirectory/fuzzers
1302 [main] INFO  org.parosproxy.paros.Constant - Creating directory /tmp/somedirectory/plugin
```

But when I run the plugin update it removes plugins from the installation directory and moves it to the default home directory:

```bash
⋊> /A/O/C/Java pwd
/Applications/OWASP ZAP.app/Contents/Java

⋊> /A/O/C/Java bash zap.sh -cmd -addonupdate
Found Java version 11.0.16.1
Available memory: 0 MB
1184 [main] INFO  org.parosproxy.paros.Constant - Creating directory /Users/user/Library/Application Support/ZAP/session
1187 [main] INFO  org.parosproxy.paros.Constant - Creating directory /Users/user/Library/Application Support/ZAP/dirbuster
1187 [main] INFO  org.parosproxy.paros.Constant - Creating directory /Users/user/Library/Application Support/ZAP/fuzzers
1187 [main] INFO  org.parosproxy.paros.Constant - Creating directory /Users/user/Library/Application Support/ZAP/plugin
Add-on downloaded to: /Users/user/Library/Application Support/ZAP/plugin/encoder-release-1.1.0.zap
Add-on downloaded to: /Users/user/Library/Application Support/ZAP/plugin/hud-beta-0.16.0.zap
Add-on downloaded to: /Users/user/Library/Application Support/ZAP/plugin/fuzz-beta-13.9.0.zap
Add-on downloaded to: /Users/user/Library/Application Support/ZAP/plugin/retire-release-0.23.0.zap
Add-on downloaded to: /Users/user/Library/Application Support/ZAP/plugin/domxss-release-15.zap
Add-on downloaded to: /Users/user/Library/Application Support/ZAP/plugin/retest-alpha-0.5.0.zap
Add-on downloaded to: /Users/user/Library/Application Support/ZAP/plugin/formhandler-beta-6.3.0.zap
Add-on downloaded to: /Users/user/Library/Application Support/ZAP/plugin/exim-beta-0.5.0.zap
Add-on downloaded to: /Users/user/Library/Application Support/ZAP/plugin/alertFilters-release-16.zap
Add-on downloaded to: /Users/user/Library/Application Support/ZAP/plugin/quickstart-release-37.zap
Add-on downloaded to: /Users/user/Library/Application Support/ZAP/plugin/replacer-release-12.zap
Add-on downloaded to: /Users/user/Library/Application Support/ZAP/plugin/oast-beta-0.15.0.zap
Add-on downloaded to: /Users/user/Library/Application Support/ZAP/plugin/bruteforce-beta-13.zap
Add-on downloaded to: /Users/user/Library/Application Support/ZAP/plugin/callhome-release-0.6.0.zap
Add-on downloaded to: /Users/user/Library/Application Support/ZAP/plugin/scripts-release-38.zap
Add-on downloaded to: /Users/user/Library/Application Support/ZAP/plugin/automation-beta-0.29.0.zap
Add-on downloaded to: /Users/user/Library/Application Support/ZAP/plugin/spider-release-0.4.0.zap
Add-on downloaded to: /Users/user/Library/Application Support/ZAP/plugin/websocket-release-28.zap
Add-on downloaded to: /Users/user/Library/Application Support/ZAP/plugin/commonlib-release-1.14.0.zap
Add-on downloaded to: /Users/user/Library/Application Support/ZAP/plugin/requester-beta-7.2.0.zap
Add-on downloaded to: /Users/user/Library/Application Support/ZAP/plugin/ascanrules-release-55.zap
Add-on downloaded to: /Users/user/Library/Application Support/ZAP/plugin/graphql-alpha-0.17.0.zap
Add-on downloaded to: /Users/user/Library/Application Support/ZAP/plugin/pscanrules-release-49.zap
Add-on downloaded to: /Users/user/Library/Application Support/ZAP/plugin/spiderAjax-release-23.14.1.zap
Add-on downloaded to: /Users/user/Library/Application Support/ZAP/plugin/soap-beta-17.zap
Add-on downloaded to: /Users/user/Library/Application Support/ZAP/plugin/zest-beta-38.zap
Add-on downloaded to: /Users/user/Library/Application Support/ZAP/plugin/webdrivermacos-release-56.zap
Add-on downloaded to: /Users/user/Library/Application Support/ZAP/plugin/selenium-release-15.12.1.zap
Add-on downloaded to: /Users/user/Library/Application Support/ZAP/plugin/network-beta-0.9.0.zap
Add-on downloaded to: /Users/user/Library/Application Support/ZAP/plugin/openapi-beta-33.zap
Add-on downloaded to: /Users/user/Library/Application Support/ZAP/plugin/reports-release-0.22.0.zap
Add-on update check complete

⋊> /A/O/C/Java pwd
/Applications/OWASP ZAP.app/Contents/Java

⋊> /A/O/C/Java ls -1 plugin/ 
Readme.txt
database-alpha-0.1.0.zap
diff-beta-12.zap
directorylistv1-release-5.zap
gettingStarted-release-14.zap
graaljs-alpha-0.3.0.zap
help-release-15.zap
invoke-beta-12.zap
onlineMenu-release-10.zap
reveal-release-5.zap
tips-beta-10.zap
```

Now if I run a zap command with the custom home directory, it fails to run:

```bash
⋊> /A/O/C/Java pwd
/Applications/OWASP ZAP.app/Contents/Java

⋊> /A/O/C/Java bash zap.sh -cmd -dir /tmp/somedirectory
Found Java version 11.0.16.1
Available memory: 0 MB
1154 [main] INFO  org.parosproxy.paros.Constant - Copying default configuration to /tmp/somedirectory/config.xml
1297 [main] INFO  org.parosproxy.paros.Constant - Creating directory /tmp/somedirectory/session
1298 [main] INFO  org.parosproxy.paros.Constant - Creating directory /tmp/somedirectory/dirbuster
1298 [main] INFO  org.parosproxy.paros.Constant - Creating directory /tmp/somedirectory/fuzzers
1298 [main] INFO  org.parosproxy.paros.Constant - Creating directory /tmp/somedirectory/plugin
Failed to start ZAP. The mandatory add-on was not found: callhome
Refer to https://www.zaproxy.org/docs/developer/ if you are building ZAP from source.
```

The bug is relevant to the Mac OS systems, because the user has ownership of the installation directory. But in order to reproduce it on linux you need to change the owner of the installation directory to your current user:

```bash
sudo chown -R user:user /path/to/installation/zap/directory/
```

### Steps to reproduce the behavior

1. Perform fresh installation of Zap
2. Change the owner of the installation folder to the current user (linux users only)

```bash
sudo chown -R user:user /path/to/installation/zap/directory/
```

4. Go to the zap installation directory

```bash
cd /path/to/zap/installation/directory
```

6. Run the plugin update

```bash
bash zap.sh -cmd -addonupdate
```

7. Run the zap with the custom home directory

```bash
bash zap.sh -cmd -dir /tmp/somedirectory
```

### Expected behavior

The command is completed without errors.

### Software versions

```
OWASP ZAP
Version: 2.12.0
Installed Add-ons: [[id=alertFilters, version=16.0.0], [id=ascanrules, version=55.0.0], [id=automation, version=0.29.0], [id=bruteforce, version=13.0.0], [id=callhome, version=0.6.0], [id=commonlib, version=1.14.0], [id=database, version=0.1.0], [id=diff, version=12.0.0], [id=directorylistv1, version=5.0.0], [id=domxss, version=15.0.0], [id=encoder, version=1.1.0], [id=exim, version=0.5.0], [id=formhandler, version=6.3.0], [id=fuzz, version=13.9.0], [id=gettingStarted, version=14.0.0], [id=graaljs, version=0.3.0], [id=graphql, version=0.17.0], [id=help, version=15.0.0], [id=hud, version=0.16.0], [id=invoke, version=12.0.0], [id=network, version=0.9.0], [id=oast, version=0.15.0], [id=onlineMenu, version=10.0.0], [id=openapi, version=33.0.0], [id=pscanrules, version=49.0.0], [id=quickstart, version=37.0.0], [id=replacer, version=12.0.0], [id=reports, version=0.22.0], [id=requester, version=7.2.0], [id=retest, version=0.5.0], [id=retire, version=0.23.0], [id=reveal, version=5.0.0], [id=scripts, version=38.0.0], [id=selenium, version=15.12.1], [id=soap, version=17.0.0], [id=spider, version=0.4.0], [id=spiderAjax, version=23.14.1], [id=tips, version=10.0.0], [id=webdrivermacos, version=56.0.0], [id=websocket, version=28.0.0], [id=zest, version=38.0.0]]
Operating System: Mac OS X
Architecture: x86_64
Java Version: Eclipse Adoptium 11.0.16.1
System's Locale: en_CZ
Display Locale: en_GB
Format Locale: en_GB
Default Charset: UTF-8
ZAP Home Directory: /Users/user/Library/Application Support/ZAP/
ZAP Installation Directory: /Applications/OWASP ZAP.app/Contents/Java/./
Look and Feel: Mac OS X (com.apple.laf.AquaLookAndFeel)
```

issue.title: [ZAP]regression workaround for MacOS missing addon

repository.name: rapidast
repository.description: RapiDAST enables simple, continuous and fully automated application security testing

issue.body:
This is a workaround for upstream ZAP issue 7703
https://github.com/zaproxy/zaproxy/issues/7703

Waiting for the upstream fix to be pulled in a stable release.

Issue description:
ZAP attempts to delete outdated plugins. The problem is that, in MacOS, the installation is done as the user, and thus the user has permission to delete the installation's plugins, and most of the plugins are deleted.
The updated version of those plugins are stored in the user's home ZAP directory, but RapiDAST no longer use this directory.

The result is: ZAP refuses to start because 2 mandatory plugins are missing.

The workaround:
When the mandatory plugins are found to be missing, this happens:

1) the plugins are manually downloaded, straight from upstream. This is sufficient to run ZAP, but not sufficient to run RapiDAST, because other plugins are still missing (e.g.: automation plugin)

2) RapiDAST then installs *all* plugins.

The downside of this is a longer runtime, because not only RapiDAST must be run 1 more time, it also has to download all plugins. The other downside is size: the plugin are roughly ½GB in size. This will be deleted after the RapiDAST run (in case of success).

To avoid the downside, in MacOS, you can do the following: 
1- Reinstall ZAP, but DO NOT RUN IT! (or it will delete the installation plugins)
2- change the ownership of the ZAP application to `root`, so that when run as a regular user, the deletion of the plugins will fail. 
3- then you can run ZAP and RapiDAST normally

The README was updated to contain the above information, in the "troubleshooting" chapter.

body: This issue has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
